p: The inhibitory activities of various dilutions of P. sidoides extracts were concentration-dependent in all the kinases except HSK, RBKS and AsK (Fig. 3). No inhibition was observed at 1 × 10 − 6 mg/ml of P. sidoides on ThiL and RBKS kinases. The most susceptible enzymes to P. sidoides extract were SK and GK with the lowest IC 50 values of 1.17 mg/ml and 1.4 mg/ml, respectively, when compared to other kinases (Table 1).
